pull.title: Introduce SafeDbt to handle Dbt with free or memory_cleanse raii-style
pull.body:
This provides additional exception-safety and case handling for the proper
freeing of the associated buffers.

rename.from: Introduce `SafeDbt` to handle `Dbt` with `free` or `memory_cleanse` raii-style
rename.to: Introduce SafeDbt to handle Dbt with free or memory_cleanse raii-style

events.body:
Ok just pushed some significant changes:
* Now called `SafeDbt`, and applied in all cases where `memory_cleanse` was used with `Dbt`
* No longer in an anonymous namespace as that is a violation of [DCL59-CPP](https://wiki.sei.cmu.edu/confluence/display/cplusplus/DCL59-CPP.+Do+not+define+an+unnamed+namespace+in+a+header+file), instead nest it inside `BerkeleyBatch`, as all uses are therein.
* Implementation is now in `db.cpp`

events.body:
Added another commit:
* Make `SafeDbt` `DB_DBT_MALLOC` on default initialization
* Ran `clang-format`

Separate for easier review, can squash.

verification.payload:
tree 33c6ddfc06796a2b7e5bb98da1076969c02c5080
parent 1a9f9f7e5e2e73fb832f5b96ad7e9e57954f3f3c
author Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1543114148 -0600
committer Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1543115148 -0600

Make SafeDbt DB_DBT_MALLOC on default initialization

If we're constructing the SafeDbt without provided data, it is always malloced,
so that is the case we expose.

Also run clang-format.

Make SafeDbt DB_DBT_MALLOC on default initialization

If we're constructing the SafeDbt without provided data, it is always malloced,
so that is the case we expose.

Also run clang-format.

events.body: Appveyor failure looks unrelated: "ConnectionAbortedError: [WinError 10053] An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine"

comments.body: Perhaps add a comment here explaining why the explicit `free` is needed and where the matching allocation takes place?

```
2018-09-22 20:42:07 cpplint(pr=14268): src/wallet/db.h:204:  Anonymous namespace should be terminated with "// namespace"  [readability/namespace] [5]
```
nit: You can drop the `private` access modifier. `m_dbt` is implicitly declared private, because private is the default class access level.
nit, IMO class name could be improved, as it also calls `memory_cleanse`. Maybe `SafeDbt` — I'm sure there is a better name 😛

it's returning a mutable pointer to the internal structure, I don't think it'd make sense to make the method const (unless you mean it should return a `const*` pointer too, but that's likely not good enough for the BDB functions)

This changes behavior: in the case of `Write` it was also cleansing the dtabase key, now it no longer is.
Not sure if this is necessary, I don't think the database keys ever contain sensitive information, but it should be noted.

I believe it is cleansing the key - if you're referring to the cleansing here:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14268/files#diff-c557c8e6d496041acccfd8ac4e3db625L257

Then the key and value are separate `SafeDbt` objects, with each managing/cleansing its own data:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14268/files#diff-c557c8e6d496041acccfd8ac4e3db625R258
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14268/files#diff-c557c8e6d496041acccfd8ac4e3db625R264
